title: 115_s3555
content: The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" defines LGBT and older LGBT individuals, amending the Older Americans Act of 1965. It also establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" amends the Older Americans Act of 1965 to establish the Office of Older LGBT Policy within the Administration. The Office will be headed by a Director who will coordinate activities to improve services for older LGBT individuals. The Office of Older LGBT Policy will advocate for older LGBT individuals at the federal and state levels, support research on LGBT aging, and disseminate relevant information. The Office of Older LGBT Policy will support research on LGBT aging, gather statistics, collect information on challenges faced by older LGBT individuals, recommend beneficial policies, and administer grants to help this population. The Office of Older LGBT Policy will administer grants to support older LGBT individuals, including culturally competent care services, and evaluate grant activities every five years for reporting to Congress. SEC. 423. RURAL OUTREACH GRANT PROGRAM added to the Older Americans Act of 1965 for administering grants to support older LGBT individuals. The section defines key terms like Director, eligible entity, and rural area for the Rural Outreach Grant Program under the Older Americans Act of 1965. The purpose of this section is to provide resources and incentives for connecting with older LGBT individuals in rural areas through grants to eligible entities approved by the Director. An eligible entity seeking a grant under this section must submit an application to the Director with details on proposed activities, population served, resources available, and intent to partner with local entities. An eligible entity seeking a grant under this section must submit an application to the Director with details on proposed activities, population served, resources available, and intent to partner with local entities. The application must include a description of public and private resources, intent to partner with local organizations in rural areas, evidence of meeting urgent needs not met by other sources, and any additional information required by the Director for approval of activities. The Director approves activities for grants under this section to create partnerships between older LGBT individuals in rural areas and the eligible entity. Approved activities may include education, community outreach, reducing isolation, and improving access to care for this population. The approved activities for grants under this section aim to reduce isolation and improve access to care for older LGBT individuals in rural areas by fostering relationships, improving cultural competency, and expanding non-discrimination policies to protect sexual orientation and gender identity. The Director will establish standards and guidelines for approved activities supported by grants to protect sexual orientation and gender identity, create inclusive community spaces for older LGBT individuals, and allow for local adaptations. Eligible entities must cooperate and coordinate with local entities when carrying out approved activities. An eligible entity receiving a grant under this section must cooperate and coordinate with relevant State and local agencies, as well as public and private organizations serving older LGBT individuals. Priority should be given to collaborating with organizations that cater to economically underserved populations. The Director shall prioritize cooperating with organizations serving economically underserved populations. Reports on activities must be submitted to Congress every second fiscal year.
